Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: In response to the growing demand for sustainable business practices, many companies have taken steps to reduce their environmental footprint and promote social responsibility. Some common examples include implementing energy-efficient technologies, reducing waste through recycling programs, adopting renewable energy sources like solar or wind power, promoting diversity and inclusion in the workplace, supporting local communities through philanthropy or community development initiatives, and ensuring responsible supply chain management. By examining these areas, you can gain insight into a company's commitment to sustainability and environmental stewardship.

source.content: tactics to a more sustainable and equitable future For decades companies have prioritized shareholder profits and have relied on products alone to drive sales Now we are seeing “good” corporate branding coupled with positive public relations in an effort to create customer loyalty to drive sales CEOs from across diverse industries announced publicly that shareholders were not the only stakeholders in their companies Employees and suppliers must also be dealt with in an ethical and fair way Additionally they maintained that the environment must be protected and they pledged to do so  On September 3rd Walmart revised its gun policy The behemoth retailer will no longer sell handguns ammunition for handguns as well as certain short barreled rifles This decision comes after years of investor lobbying on the matter in addition to a shift in public sentiment Environmental stewardship is fundamental to a company’s sustainability and long-term profitability  Past performance is not indicative

In the past we’ve shared our approach to sustainable investing how we help our clients create change using their investments and our impact as a firm I wanted to take a moment to share what else we’re doing behind the scenes to ensure that your wealth is working to help create the future we all want to live in At Good Capital we strive to align ourselves with asset managers who share our values and who are actually working towards creating a better future not ones that are merely selling ESG products to check the box We use several different reporting tools to help us make sure that we’re doing the best we can in terms of investing to actually make a difference eg As You Sow and YourStake and Change Finance Morningstar sustainability ratings We also help to lead a group of ESG advisors within Commonwealth our broker dealer to help other advisors effectively incorporate sustainability into their practices Together we also work to push Commonwealth to be more sustainable and to offer

all to actually be sustainable So how does one spot greenwashing It can be quite tricky especially if you’re unfamiliar with the landscape You can start by asking yourself these questions and doing a bit of research on the company or fund in question Does the company have a formal commitment or mission statement around sustainable investing Or is sustainability just a recently added product line perhaps used to create additional revenue Are there clear actions to back-up the claims made by the company Or is it just wishes and empty promises What is the company’s track record when it comes to shareholder resolutions proxy voting and engaging with executive teams What greenwashing fundamentally comes down to is does a company or fund actually care about generating positive impact You can also use these third party rating tools to determine how green a company or fund actually is Sign up with your email address to receive news and updates Thank you for signing up for the Good Capital

last year in which all of the big institutional players on Wall Street participated Speaker after speaker got up on stage and stated with conviction how “sustainability is and has always been part of our ethos” These types of comments make us extremely skeptical especially since shareholder capitalism which has dominated the last several decades has dictated that companies have one purpose and one purpose only and that is to turn a profit for their shareholders Also side note Wall Street was originally built around the slave As such we approach sustainable investing with a healthy dose of skepticism We’ve seen plenty of wealth managers and investment managers who claim to be sustainable or who offer sustainable options but then it turns out they are doing the bare minimum if anything at all to actually be sustainable So how does one spot greenwashing It can be quite tricky especially if you’re unfamiliar with the landscape You can start by asking yourself these questions and doing a

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are numerous events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 specific events would not be feasible within the given constraints. Instead, here are some examples of well-known events and organizations dedicated to environmental conservation:

1. Earth Day (April 2)
2. Global Climate Strike (September 20)
3. World Environment Day (June 5)
4. United Nations Climate Change Conferences (held periodically since 197)
5. The Nature Conservancy
6. World Wildlife Fund (WWF)
7. Greenpeace
8. Sierra Club
9. Audubon Society
10. National Park Service

These are just a few examples of the many events, initiatives, and organizations working towards environmental conservation.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided text, it seems like the focus is on companies' commitment to sustainability and their efforts towards reducing negative impacts on the environment. However, specific environmental impact metrics may vary depending on the organization providing the ratings or reports. Some examples of commonly reported environmental impact metrics include carbon emissions, water usage, waste reduction, biodiversity conservation, and land use practices. These metrics can help investors assess a company's environmental footprint and progress towards sustainability goals.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, there are annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments. These reports typically provide an overview of the company's progress towards its sustainability goals, as well as any challenges faced along the way. They also highlight success stories and areas where improvements can be made. By regularly publishing such reports, companies demonstrate their dedication to transparency and continuous improvement in their sustainability efforts.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
The text mentions several resources and platforms that offer different products, services, and technologies. Some examples include:

1. Ladies Get Paid and Female Founders Collective: These directories connect users with women-owned businesses offering various products and services.
2. Regularly updated blog tracking brand responses to racial injustice: This resource provides information on brands that are actively responding to issues related to racial justice.
3. Wool and the Gang: This is a women-owned fashion brand that specializes in handmade, ethically produced clothing and accessories.
4. Together let's be intentional about buying: The text encourages readers to be mindful of their purchases and consider supporting responsible and sustainable companies.
5. Conscious consumerism to the next level: By suggesting alternatives like donating to environmental causes instead of buying expensive organic sheets, the text promotes a higher level of awareness around consumption choices.

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result: The key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce involve multiple stakeholders working together towards common goals. These include suppliers, communities, shareholders, governments, NGOs, and other businesses. By fostering strong relationships among these parties, businesses can create mutually beneficial outcomes, promote social and environmental responsibility, and contribute to overall economic growth. Examples of such partnerships include supply chain initiatives, corporate social responsibility programs, public-private sector collaboration, and impact investing networks.

suppliers communities and shareholders Stakeholder capitalism is a form of capitalism in which companies seek long-term value creation by taking into account the needs of all their stakeholders and society at large This type of system calls on businesses and organizations to consider not only their shareholders but also their employees customers communities and the environment In the past 50 years the world has become more global and interconnected than we could have ever imagined This past year’s pandemic has been a lesson in how our individual actions can have long-ranging consequences on others across the world Companies no longer have the luxury to ignore the external impacts of their actions George Serafeim has an idea to hold companies accountable Serafeim is revolutionizing the way businesses calculate their success “Profit and loss aren’t enough says the Harvard Business School professor Serafeim aims to do what no one has done before Put a dollar value on the impact of

Additionally, networking events and professional organizations can provide valuable connections and resources for both job seekers and students.

Financials & Funding.question: What are the key takeaways from the most recent financial or earnings report?
Financials & Funding.result:
Based on the provided text, there isn't enough information to pinpoint a specific company or industry's financial or earnings report. However, we can gather general insights from the text regarding the broader economic landscape and how different factors influence the markets. Some key takeaways include:

1. Uncertainty surrounding the timing and distribution of COVID-19 vaccines.
2. Political events, including elections and policy announcements, can impact the markets.
3. Economic indicators, such as GDP and unemployment rates, can provide insight into the health of the economy.
4. Diversification across a variety of assets helps mitigate risks associated with fluctuating markets.
5. Core investment principles, such as maintaining a diverse portfolio and focusing on long-term goals, remain important during times of uncertainty.

source.content: step up their commitment to social justice some implementing meaningful changes many just for show What a rollercoaster of a quarter Following a broad market downturn at the end of Q1 US stocks have nearly regained all of those losses April ended as the best April for stocks in 32 years However the economy hasn’t followed suit This may be because the stock market is forward looking while economic data is based on things that have already happened such as unemployment rates and GDP We will be the first to admit that there is an incredible amount of uncertainty these days When will a coronavirus vaccine be ready What will the next round of economic stimulus from the federal government look like What is going to happen to our country politically All this being the case we are staying the course Everything that has happened has reinforced our commitment to the following core investment principles Invest in a diversified portfolio to reduce overall risk and increase returns Make sure your

Here at Good Capital we strive to empower you through financial education The more you know the better you’ll be able to manage and plan for your future Happy Fall Here are some of the economic highlights from the summer months of  The delta variant political gridlock and inflation were the three key themes in the third quarter of  Let’s break it down Q2 of  had its fair share of positive virus and economic news which resulted in all-time market highs Here’s what you need to know We hope this quarterly update finds you and your family well and in good health There is a real sense of optimism as we emerge from pandemic fears and head into the spring and summer months As we look back at the first quarter and forward to the rest of the year we can identify three compelling themes Three weeks into  and already so much has happened Let’s take a few mins to look back on Q and talk about what we might expect for  It also feels nice to be able to think back on  as if we are on the other side

into  and already so much has happened Let’s take a few mins to look back on Q and talk about what we might expect for  It also feels nice to be able to think back on  as if we are on the other side of everything that happened The third quarter of  is in our rearview mirror Let's recap what transpired over the summer months The fourth quarter of  had its fair share of political drama We witnessed a historic impeachment and the start of the  election cycle What consequences if any do politics have on the direction of the stock market and ultimately your portfolio Sign up with your email address to receive news and updates Thank you for signing up for the Good Capital Investment Group Newsletter We’re excited to keep you posted on what we’re up to This communication is strictly intended for individuals residing in the states of CA CT IN MA ME MO NC NY VA VT No offers may be made or accepted from any resident outside these states due to various state regulations and registration

Three weeks into  and already so much has happened Let’s take a few mins to look back on Q and talk about what we might expect for  Joe Biden was elected President and Democrats as of early January  now control two pillars of government Markets gained ground on news of a stable transition of power The Biden administration unveiled a new 19 trillion stimulus plan which rallied stock prices COVID-19 vaccine approval from multiple companies furthered optimism that we might be out of the woods soon although some uncertainty still remains around vaccine distribution This is probably the biggest contributor to the stock market’s strong year-end finish The market had all-time highs back in February and then again in December with a short bear market dip in March However the stock market is not the economy and the economy is not the stock market While the pandemic raged on stocks soared There are many explanations for this  phenomenon but a mix between low interest rates gig economy

once again that their revenues are resilient to pandemic pressures and we expect more of the same moving forward The pandemic is still largely in control of the economy While unemployment numbers are low the US economy has lost ~42 million jobs since February  Many who have left the workforce are mothers There is still a long recovery road ahead and this recovery like previous recoveries appears to be unequal across racial gender and geographical divides  Domestic inflation is tracking above the Federal Reserve’s target of 2 due to the increased demand in goods and supply chain bottlenecks We’re expecting to see some market volatility associated with the Federal Reserve's monetary policy changes We are anticipating 3 interest rate hikes in  as well as the Fed pulling back on its asset buying program We do not expect to see the end of the pandemic in  However we do expect robust ways of coping and living with it Cheers to a solid year ahead Sign up with your email address to receive

on it I painstakingly whittled the list down to 10 If you’re wondering what the other 10 were I’d be more than happy to share them with you Time to get to listening and learning Here’s a list of our absolute faves April 22  marks the 50th anniversary of Earth Day Here’s what we’re doing throughout the week to show our appreciation for and celebrate our planet Earth In the first three months of  the world changed before our eyes In January our major global concerns were the Australian wildfires the trade war with China and the Presidential impeachment Now the economy and markets are driven by reactions to the spread of the coronavirus as well as government responses Nobody can predict the market However there are experts who have been in the industry for many years who invest and look at the markets for a living And no we aren’t talking about ourselves We’re not famous enough to be quotedyet Check out our conversation with Jaimie Pruden and Meghan Offtermatt at How To Save The World

Q2 of  had its fair share of positive virus and economic news which resulted in all-time market highs Some notable happenings between April and June of this year ·  Lowest infection rates in the US since  There is comforting evidence that multiple vaccines have been effective against COVID including against the highly contagious Delta variant ·  Accelerated job growth The economy generated about 17 million new jobs during the quarter ·  Continued growth in US stocks The SP and Dow Jones Industrial Average had record highs ·  Sharply increased US GDP projection of 7 due to unprecedented fiscal and monetary support from the Federal Reserve and Congress Uncertainty still remains top of mind as we enter the second half of  Even with all the positive virus and economic news pandemic risks still exist We continue to be cautiously optimistic about future economic growth There has been lots of noise regarding the possibility of increased inflation and its potentially unfavorable economic

dominate our lives and headlines across the world Cases in the US reached 3 million and cases continue climbing in a majority of states States began reopening but many have had to close again The US’ haphazard opening strategy has resulted in skyrocketing infection rates Political divides continue to widen as coronavirus responses are split along party lines Emergency benefits are set to expire soon Will there be another round of stimulus checks and government relief coming The Black Lives Matter movement sparked protests across the world ignited by George Floyd Ahmaud Arbery and Breonna Taylor’s murders Police reform is a priority across the country as the Minneapolis City Council has voted to dismantle the police department and budget cuts have been implemented for the LAPD and NYPD Companies step up their commitment to social justice some implementing meaningful changes many just for show What a rollercoaster of a quarter Following a broad market downturn at the end of Q1 US stocks

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
The organization mentioned in the text is collaborating with several organizations, institutions, and entities. Some of these include:

1. As You Sow - A non-profit organization that empowers shareholders to create corporate change.
2. North Star Fund - An organization that supports grassroots groups led by and/or serving low-income people and people of color.
3. RG Giving Guide - A resource for discovering charities and nonprofits aligned with one's values.
4. One For Democracy Pledge - A campaign encouraging Americans to pledge to vote in every election, including primaries.
5. The Giving Project - A program designed to engage participants in collective giving and strategic grantmaking.
6. The Good Capital Investment Group - A group focused on creating positive social and environmental change through investments.

To have a positive impact on society through our investments We believe that we as a community wield immense power and that together we can create change That's why we help purpose-driven individuals and families align their money with their values while growing their wealth Often when people think about sustainability or wellness they forget to take into account their financial sustainability and their financial wellness We're here to change that By divesting from harmful industries such as gun manufacturers tobacco companies and coal products and actively making a positive impact on large corporations through proxy votes and shareholder resolutions our clients are working to create positive change using their wealth while feeling more confident about their finances We whole-heartedly trust that by making socially conscious choices together we can make a difference all without sacrificing performance We bring high quality and personalized holistic wealth management and sustainable

philanthropy focuses on the root causes of social racial economic and environmental injustices It strives to include the people who are impacted by those injustices as decision-makers It also aims to make the field of philanthropy more accessible and diverse In social justice philanthropy foundations are accountable transparent and responsive in their grantmaking Donors and foundations act as allies to social justice movements by contributing not only monetary resources but their time knowledge skills and access” We’ve thought a lot about the kind of world we want to live in and how we can use our money to help construct that world Similar to sustainable and socially responsible investing we are supporting organizations that exemplify our values So far in  on a personal level we have created a giving plan check out RG’s giving guide to learn more signed the RG giving pledge taken the One for Democracy pledge will be joining the North Star Fund Giving Project and established a donor

companies to create positive social and environmental change You might be wondering what this all means for you First make sure you educate yourself on shareholder advocacy and how you can take advantage of your investments to create change Be sure to check out As You Sow a non-profit that empowers shareholders to create corporate change Second invest with asset managers that represent your values After all money is power Go ahead let that power get to your head Let’s use it for good Sign up with your email address to receive news and updates Thank you for signing up for the Good Capital Investment Group Newsletter We’re excited to keep you posted on what we’re up to This communication is strictly intended for individuals residing in the states of CA CT IN MA ME MO NC NY VA VT No offers may be made or accepted from any resident outside these states due to various state regulations and registration requirements regarding investment products and services Investments are not FDIC- or

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Yes, there are several joint events, projects, and initiatives mentioned in the text. Here's a list of some of them:

1. Jointly engaging with companies and working with them to make changes.
2. Collaboration with fund managers they're invested in and holding them accountable.
3. Sharing knowledge and committing to provide free educational resources, workshops, and events to support their communities.
4. Joining the Racial Justice Investing (RJI) Coalition investor statement.
5. Working with and referring partners such as financial advisors, financial coaches, attorneys, accountants, and other professionals who share a commitment to their values.
6. Participating in various groups and organizations exploring new frontiers in sustainable and impactful investing.
7. Donating at least 1% of Good Capital's profits towards social causes.

step up their commitment to social justice some implementing meaningful changes many just for show What a rollercoaster of a quarter Following a broad market downturn at the end of Q1 US stocks have nearly regained all of those losses April ended as the best April for stocks in 32 years However the economy hasn’t followed suit This may be because the stock market is forward looking while economic data is based on things that have already happened such as unemployment rates and GDP We will be the first to admit that there is an incredible amount of uncertainty these days When will a coronavirus vaccine be ready What will the next round of economic stimulus from the federal government look like What is going to happen to our country politically All this being the case we are staying the course Everything that has happened has reinforced our commitment to the following core investment principles Invest in a diversified portfolio to reduce overall risk and increase returns Make sure your

within Commonwealth our broker dealer to help other advisors effectively incorporate sustainability into their practices Together we also work to push Commonwealth to be more sustainable and to offer more sustainable options to its network of advisors We’re currently working with Commonwealth to approve the use of YourStake metrics for our clients to add sustainable options to the bank sweep program and to add more ESG focused investing options to our platform such as CDFIs and community notes In addition Gideon and I also stay up to date on ESG happenings and trends in the industry Gideon is continuously doing research on our ESG funds and fund managers as well as keeping a pulse on what’s available in the market We actively participate in groups that are exploring what is beyond sustainable investing and what that world might look like It’s also important to us to share our knowledge and resources by participating in workshops podcasts and through our blog and newsletter We want to

a giving plan check out RG’s giving guide to learn more signed the RG giving pledge taken the One for Democracy pledge will be joining the North Star Fund Giving Project and established a donor advised fund in an effort to propel ourselves to give more than what we’ve been comfortable with in the past On top of our personal giving we are donating at least 10 of Good Capital’s  profits We’d love to invite you to join us on our giving journey Giving takes diligence and commitment and we’re here to keep each other accountable It’s also much more fun to give together Let us know your thoughts on giving and how you’ve incorporated it into your life To learn more about social justice philanthropy check out Resource Generation and the North Star Fund This is the final post in our series on the “4 Ways You Can Align Your Money With Your Values” You can find the other posts in the series here Tagged 1 conscious consumer giving plan giving intentional giving charitable giving Sign up with your

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations involve creating a positive impact on society through sustainable investing, promoting transparency and accountability among fund managers and companies, fostering education and awareness around sustainable investing, and supporting the growth of the BIPOC woman-owned business. By working together, these collaborative efforts aim to empower individuals and families to align their money with their values while growing their wealth responsibly. Additionally, these collaborations seek to drive meaningful change within the financial industry, encouraging more sustainable and responsible investing practices across the board.

macro-eceonomic strengths and weaknesses evaluating position performances and conducting investment due diligence Gideon spends much of his time talking with clients one-on-one addressing their personal financial situations He is a true partner whom you want on your life team Fun facts Gideon is an excellent salsa dancer a skill he picked up from his study abroad in Cuba Next time you see him be sure to ask him to show you his moves He also aspires to be able to complete every Sporcle quiz out there  Monica and Gideon are not only business partners but also life partners Gideon is often our idea generator while Monica is our executor We both ponder and research non-stop about how we can be and do better How can we make our investments more sustainable What else could we be doing to provide more value to our clients What can we do to further our collective values and vision for the future Thanks for being a part of the Good Capital community We’re so happy to share in this journey with
